tit.e: Rakushisha (literally, a hut where persimmons fell)
Rakushisha (literally, a hut where persimmons fell)
tit.cmt: タイトルなので補足をのぞきました。

sen.j: 落柿舎（らくししゃ）は、嵯峨野（京都府京都市右京区）にある松尾芭蕉の弟子、向井去来の草庵。
sen.e: Located in Sagano (of Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture), Rakushisha is a tea hut of Kyorai MUKAI, a follower of Basho MATSUO.
Located in Sagano (of Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture), Rakushisha is a tea hut belonging to Kyorai MUKAI, a follower of Basho MATSUO.
Rakushisha (literally, a hut where persimmons fell) is a tea hut belonging to Kyorai MUKAI, a follower of Basho MATSUO, located in Sagano (Ukyo-ku Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 庭の柿を売る契約をしたのちに、柿がすべて台風で落ちてしまったためこう呼ばれている。
sen.e: The name of Rakushisha comes from that all of the persimmons, the contract to sell which had been concluded, fell due to a typhoon.
The name of Rakushisha comes from an incident when all of the persimmons, contracted to sell, fell due to a typhoon.
The name of Rakushisha comes from an incident when all of the persimmons, contracted to sell, fell due to a typhoon.

sen.j: 1691年に松尾芭蕉が滞在して嵯峨日記を著したとされる。
sen.e: It is said that in 1691, Basho MATSUO stayed here and wrote the Saga diary.
It is said that in 1691, Basho MATSUO stayed here and wrote the Saga diary.
It is said that in 1691, Basho MATSUO stayed here and wrote the Saga Nikki (Saga diary).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 現在の庵は俳人井上重厚による再建である。
sen.e: The present hut was the one reconstructed by Juko INOUE, a haiku poet.
